thread.title: Cuba Will Now Host World Renowned Rock and Pop Concerts, DJ's, Electronic Music Plus a Variety of Stellar Events

author: cbs8
title: Cuba Will Now Host World Renowned Rock and Pop Concerts, DJ's, Electronic Music Plus a Variety of Stellar Events
text:
Bart Entertainment LTD.
Bart Entertainment, LTD., the Cuban Institute of Music, the National Center of Concert Music and National Laboratory of Electroacoustic Music sign an exclusive historical agreement!
HAVANA , Oct. 5, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Bart Entertainment LTD. and the Cuban Music Institute signed a diachronic agreement accrediting the production, promotion of live events and concerts in Cuba . The agreement provides exclusivity and facilitates the long awaited trade of world renowned international and local Cuban talent in all genres including rock, pop and electronic music. The inaugural events are earmarked to take place in Havana Cuba by the first quarter of 2016.
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151005/273828
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151005/273829
The document was signed in the Republic of Cuba at the Ministry of Culture headquarters by Orlando Vistel, President of the Cuban Institute of Music (ICM) and by the renowned international producer Mr. Bill Bakula , Director of Bart Entertainment LTD. The agreement stipulates that the production of festivals EDM events and premier concerts in Cuba , with performances by world renowned artists which will also feature an eclectic lineup of local and international Cuban stars from the vast catalog of artists in the Cuban Music Institute, the National Center of Concert Music and the National Laboratory of Electroacoustic Music. The ceremony was attended by Mr. Abel Acosta , Deputy Minister of Culture of Cuba , directors of several Cuban musical institutions and executives of Bart Entertainment, LTD., including Mr. Rick Reposa Bart's Director of Finance.
ICM and Bart Entertainment Ltd. agreed to also accomplish the production, promotion and distribution of artists in the Cuban Music Institute, the National Center of Concert Music and the National Laboratory of Electroacoustic Music roster of talent.
"This is one big step for the Cuban people and a giant leap for the mankind," said Mr. Bakula. "Our duty as a race is to never allow foreign corporate interests to interfere with cultural exchange; after all there is only one race, the human race. The Cuban people have always had their hearts open to the world. We should all welcome the same."
